jobDescription: Our companyAt Adobe, we create digital experiences that change the world. How? We help people bring ideas to life by creating content that makes life more fun and work more impactful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data and Artificial Intelligence to help companies find and reach the people who crave that content.We do it with energy, passion, and curiosity, and we’re backed by our rich heritage and culture of innovation. We’re looking for exceptional talent to join us.The challengeAdobe is looking for a research scientist to help build the next generation of experience cloud products by leveraging machine learning, artificial intelligence, and especially deep learning techniques. As an Applied Research Scientist, you will research and develop novel algorithms and modeling techniques to advance the start of art of customer experience optimization, ranging from content creation, content understanding, content variation, content assembly, content personalization, to content delivery & channel optimization. You will leverage Adobe’s unique data sources which includes not only contents (such as images, videos, texts), but also how the customers interacting with those contents (such as media touches, click streams, customer responses, conversions) from various verticals (retailer, financial services, healthcare and etc.) in both B2B and B2C contexts. As a part of the engineering and intelligence services team, your research work will directly impact our customers in the form of products and services that make use of AI and deep learning.What you’ll doIdentify research opportunities and define the problems through collaborating with product management, engineering, and data science groups.Perform research, build prototypes/demos, write research papers/reports, present research results.Collaborate with product management, engineering, and data science groups to transfer the research outcomes to products.Guide junior research scientists or data scientists (for senior level candidates only)Required QualificationsPhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Applied Math or relevant majors with research specialization in artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer vision, or natural language processing.Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, R, Java and CFamiliar with one or more deep learning frameworks, such as Tensorflow, Keras, Caffe, Torch, MXnet, and CNTK.Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability.Excellent communication, relationship skills and a strong team player.Job level will depend on experiencePreferred QualificationsExtensive experience of applying deep learning techniques to computer vision or natural language processing is strongly preferred.Experience of working with very large data sets.Ability to write production quality code (the core algorithms can potentially be leveraged in the products with minimum refactoring)Strong publication records in relevant areasAt Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.
